summary: This document is an email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) personnel discussing the handling of a Touhy request from an Epstein victim (Maria Lacerda) for documents related to the Epstein investigation. It details the office's response, including producing some documents but declining further requests due to the ongoing investigation, and clarifies jurisdictional issues between SDNY, S.D. Fla., and N.D. Ga.

persons.name: Steven Kochevar
persons.context: Point person handling Touhy requests from Epstein victims; drafts and sends response letters and coordinates document production.

persons.name: John McEnany
persons.context: Supervises and provides guidance on the Touhy request process; confirms the identity of the victim and approves document disclosure.

persons.name: Alex
persons.context: Coordinates with the civil division on Touhy requests; liaises with victim's counsel and provides knowledge of the criminal investigation.

persons.name: Maria Lacerda
persons.context: Identified as the 'Jane Doe' making the Touhy request; a plaintiff in a civil suit against Epstein's estate.

persons.name: Robbie Kaplan
persons.context: Counsel for the victim (Maria Lacerda) at the law firm Kaplan Hecker; the primary contact for the Touhy request.

persons.name: Alison
persons.context: Signed off on the response letter and document production for the Touhy request.

persons.name: Maurene
persons.context: Signed off on the response letter and document production for the Touhy request.

persons.name: Jeffrey O
persons.context: Mentioned as having been consulted about using Steven Kochevar as the point of contact for Touhy requests.

persons.name: Rossmiller
persons.context: Previously received the initial request for information from the victim's counsel.

connections.description: Work together in the U.S. Attorney's Office on handling Epstein-related Touhy requests; McEnany provides supervisory approval to Kochevar's actions.
Coordinate between the civil and criminal divisions of the U.S. Attorney's Office to manage document requests from Epstein victims.
Alex communicates with victim's counsel Robbie Kaplan regarding the process for making formal document requests.
Robbie Kaplan is the attorney representing Maria Lacerda in her civil suit against Epstein's estate and in making the Touhy request.
McEnany consulted with Jeffrey O about procedural decisions regarding Touhy request handling.

events.title: Production of Documents to Epstein Victim
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) produced documents responsive to a Touhy request from Epstein victim Maria Lacerda.

events.title: Decision to Not Produce Further Documents
events.description: SDNY attorneys decide not to produce additional materials requested by the victim's counsel, citing materials being part of the ongoing investigation.

events.title: Establishment of Touhy Request Protocol
events.description: SDNY attorneys establish a protocol for handling future Touhy requests from Epstein victims, designating Steven Kochevar as the point of contact.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) produced documents to Epstein victim Maria Lacerda in response to a Touhy request but declined to fulfill follow-up requests, citing the ongoing investigation.
The email confirms that 'Jane Doe' in the request is specifically identified as Maria Lacerda, a plaintiff in a civil suit against Epstein's estate.

The office clarifies jurisdictional handling, stating that for Epstein purposes, the Northern District of Georgia (N.D. Ga.) has 'stepped into the shoes' of the Southern District of Florida (S.D. Fla.), directing future requests accordingly.

The correspondence reveals an internal protocol where the Civil Division (Steven Kochevar) handles external Touhy communications, while Criminal Division AUSAs (like Alex) provide investigative knowledge and liaise with victims' counsel.
The document includes detailed draft language explaining the Touhy regulations, highlighting the legal barriers to disclosing information from an ongoing criminal investigation.
